Message:
The one who saved me as
I drifted unconscious atop
the lake was a gentleman
from another world.

His tone of voice
was ever so gentle,
and the sound of
his heartbeat was calm,
like the steady beating
of a drum.

But, I did not deserve
to be saved.
After all, I was the one
who caused everyone to...

If I had only become nothing
but bubbles melting into
the lapping waves of the lake,
that would have made
everyone far more...

Then, my harp rang out
by itself once more.
But, it was not my sound.

the distant encouragement
I had always heard from afar—
all of the musicians’ sound.

I began to play
my harp in response.

Sorry, everyone.
I caused all of this...
Which is why...I must go.

I know not if this
shall atone for my sins.

But, I also know only languishing
in despair solves nothing.
That is why I must leave here.

Just as music has
shown me the world,

I shall color this
broken world with my song.

The sound of lament only
leaves the world dull,
which is why we must play.

The notes woven by all—
the song of this world.
